root.para: The following AU-C sections are particularly relevant to audits of financial instruments:

listitem.para:
AU-C section 540B, , addresses the auditor’s responsibilities relating to auditing accounting estimates, including accounting estimates related to financial instruments measured at fair value. Auditing Accounting Estimates, Including Fair Value Accounting Estimates, and Related Disclosures
Each AU-C section in this guide designated with a “B” suffix (for example, “AU-C section 200B”) denotes content that does not reflect the codification of SAS Nos. 134–140 or or the amendments to other SASs made by SAS Nos. 134–140 and subsequently issued SASs.
All AU-C sections can be found in AICPA .
Professional Standards

AU-C section 315B, , and AU-C section 330B, , address identifying and assessing risks of material misstatement and responding to those risks. Understanding the Entity and Its Environment and Assessing the Risks of Material Misstatement Performing Audit Procedures in Response to Assessed Risks and Evaluating the Audit Evidence Obtained

AU-C section 500B, , explains what constitutes audit evidence and addresses the auditor’s responsibility to design and perform audit procedures to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence to be able to draw reasonable conclusions on which to base the auditor’s opinion. Audit Evidence

AU-C section 501B, , addresses certain specific aspects relating to auditing the valuation of investments in securities and derivative instruments. Audit Evidence — Specific Considerations for Selected Items
